column4: Hi guys, I just upgraded my laptop to jaunty and now i have some strange display problems. The desktop displays perfectly, everything runs smoothly but Ubuntu does not fill the screen, it has two strips top to bottom on the outer left and right of the screen that are not being used, it reminds me of the annoying black lines on the top and bottom of your tv when watching a film on tv.
Hope this makes sense, if you need more information please ask.
do you know what the current screen resolution is?
1024x768 i believe
can you paste the output of "xrandr -q"
http://pastebin.com/f1bd7b670
try running "xrandr -s 1280x800"
nice one batman! fixed, was 768 too small then?
If it was a laptop then its screen porbally did not support 4:3 aspect ratios.. this is most likely its native resolution
it just depends on the video card and monitor..
oh, il remember that ty --i had a thread on this on ubuntuforums, i credited you (dotblank1) for the fix, did you want your forum name on their as well?
its ok..
ok, cheers :)
can you paste your /etc/X11/xorg.conf file
its standard  dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg   -- http://pastebin.com/f54f3da42
wierd you could make a startup script to change it..
or use the display dialog in preferance.. I dont know if that will persist
no, i dont need to go that far, i know it can be set in xorg.conf just dont remember the correct string or which section
the display dialog does not have an option to save settings
well you can set it modelines and if its nvidia it does it a completly differant way
ok, il do some research, ty
